Text: hi 80z...never ending indeed...do you have the experimental products song called who is kip jones...i got the album from you and its great..thanks
and thank you for this one it looks like another winner
catsout, you're welcome. I have Who Is Kip Jones?. It's on their Experimental! EP. write to me at danieldking at gmail.com and I'd e-mail it to you. Cheers

80zforever delivers the goods again...

I've had the 7" vinyl of Robert Hazard's "Escalator Of Life" since it was new(ish), and I've always dug both it and it's b-side "Say Yo" (digitized them both for ye olde ipod), but I've never actually heard anything else by him ever, so I can't wait to snag this full album that appears to include a live version of "Say Yo".  Nicey nice nice, thanks as always for your hard work!

JonYo, Robert Hazard was one of the heroes of my restless youth. God bless his soul. Unfortunately the vinyl is not in a very good shape cause I played it to death but it's an amazing record. Did you know Robert Hazard wrote Cyndi Lauper's Girls Wanna have Fun?
and heres another 80s trivia fact,the lead singer of 80s new wave group seona dancing is none other than hollywood hotshot ricky gervais.
Oh yes, afraid of mice! Thank you so much, i've been after this for years!

I don't know any of this artists but somehow, something tells me i've gotta download this and listen to it. I think this is the magic of the 80s. It's almost 30 years past but it still feels like it's just around the corner holding on to our youth.
the robert hazard album rocks...followed swiftly by white animals and the ravyns...great stuff 80z

and "Hang Up The Phone" by Annie Golden, which was on the Sixteen Candles soundtrack
